newsitem.title: USA: Elan targets $1 bln revenue by year 2000.
newsitem.headline: Elan targets $1 bln revenue by year 2000.

text.p: Elan Corp Plc said on Wednesday it set a goal of posting $1 billion in annual revenue by the year 2000.
Elan, which in July merged with Athena Neurosciences Inc, aims to post $400 million of revenue in 1997, chief operating officer John Groom told a meeting with industry analysts.
He said a combined Elan-Athena would have posted total revenue of $307 million in the 12 months ended June 30, 1996.
"We've set ourselves a goal of achieving $1 billion in total revenues by the year 2000," Groom said.
Thomas Lynch, Elan's chief financial officer, said the Athena acquisition, a $637 million stock deal, would bring a one-time charge of $465 million in the current quarter.
The company expects the merger to dilute earnings per share by about 15 to 20 percent in the third and fourth quarter, Lynch said.
The acquisition will be neutral to earnings in 1997, and Elan expects "strong accretion" in 1998, he said.
Elan executives said the Athena acquisition would add a pipeline of central nervous system drugs to the company's existing line of drug-delivery products.
